snippet: A Pew survey found that since 2011, China’s approval rating in the United States dropped to 37 percent and negative attitudes toward the United States among the Chinese rose to 53 percent.
abstract: Pew Global Survey finds that Americans view China in markedly less favorable light than two years ago, and Chinese attitudes toward United States have also soured, sign that the two countries are drifting apart at the level of public opinion.
lead_paragraph: A Pew survey found that since 2011, China’s approval rating in the United States dropped to 37 percent and negative attitudes toward the United States among the Chinese rose to 53 percent.

headline.main: In China and U.S., Mutual Distrust Grows, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: In China and U.S., Mutual Distrust Grows, Study Finds
